channel.title: CVE Feed for NVIDIA -- NVIDIA Cloud Gaming (guest driver)
channel.description: The latest CVEs for NVIDIA -- NVIDIA Cloud Gaming (guest driver)

item.title: CVE-2022-31613|2024-08-03T07:26:01.011Z -- nvidia -- nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Windows contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer, where any local user can cause a null-pointer dereference, which may lead to a kernel panic.

item.title: CVE-2022-31612|2024-08-03T07:26:01.182Z -- nvidia -- nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Windows contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape, where a local user with basic capabilities can cause an out-of-bounds read, which may lead to a system crash or a leak of internal kernel information.

item.title: CVE-2022-31616|2024-08-03T07:26:00.838Z -- nvidia -- nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Windows contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape, where a local user with basic capabilities can cause an out-of-bounds read, which may lead to denial of service, or information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2022-31617|2024-08-03T07:26:00.806Z -- nvidia -- nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Windows contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys), where a local user with basic capabilities can cause an out-of-bounds read, which may lead to code execution, denial of service, escalation of privileges, information disclosure, or data tampering.

item.title: CVE-2022-31606|2024-08-03T07:26:00.408Z -- nvidia -- nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Windows contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handler for DxgkDdiEscape, where a failure to properly validate data might allow an attacker with basic user capabilities to cause an out-of-bounds access in kernel mode, which could lead to denial of service, information disclosure, escalation of privileges, or data tampering.

item.title: CVE-2022-31610|2024-08-03T07:26:00.721Z -- nvidia -- nvidia%20cloud%20gaming%20%28guest%20driver%29
item.description: NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Windows contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys), where a local user with basic capabilities can cause an out-of-bounds write, which may lead to code execution, denial of service, escalation of privileges, information disclosure, or data tampering.
